meanings.definition: A drug used to prevent and treat nausea, vomiting, and dizziness caused by motion sickness.
meanings.sent1: I took dimenhydrinate before the boat ride to avoid feeling sick.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed dimenhydrinate to help with my motion sickness.
meanings.sent3: After taking dimenhydrinate, I felt like a superhero conquering the waves without getting queasy.
meanings.sent4: The dimenhydrinate was a shield against the storm of nausea on the turbulent sea.
meanings.sent5: The dimenhydrinate pill was my lifesaver on the rocky boat trip.

meanings.definition: To administer dimenhydrinate to alleviate symptoms of motion sickness.
meanings.sent1: She dimenhydrinated her friend before the roller coaster ride to prevent sickness.
meanings.sent2: The nurse will dimenhydrinate the patient before the flight for a comfortable journey.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly dimenhydrinated himself before the spinning teacup ride at the fair.
meanings.sent4: The captain dimenhydrinated the crew, ensuring a smooth sailing experience.
meanings.sent5: Dimenhydrinating early can make the entire trip more enjoyable.
